intro: Solanum exemptum, commonly known as the Australian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, featuring hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals, and it produces small, round berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Solanum exemptum is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
